headline: Garlic Naan
description: Try Chef John's garlic naan recipe for garlicky bread made with yogurt-enriched dough that's cooked in a hot cast iron skillet until nicely charred.
name: Garlic Naan
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup warm water, or more as needed
2 cups bread flour, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine water, sugar, and yeast in a bowl. Let stand until yeast softens and forms a creamy foam, about 15 minutes.
Heat butter in a pan over medium heat until melted and sizzling. Quickly mix in garlic and remove from the heat.

Add bread flour, yogurt, salt, and 1 tablespoon garlic butter to yeast mixture; stir with a wooden spoon until a shaggy dough forms. Knead by hand until dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl, adding more water or flour as needed. Turn dough out onto the counter and continue kneading until it forms a smooth ball, 3 to 4 minutes.
Place dough into a large bowl and drizzle a few spoons garlic butter over top. Cover and let rise until doubled in volume, about 2 hours.

Punch dough down and turn out onto the counter. Shape into a rough rectangle and cut into 6 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and lightly dust with flour. Cover with plastic wrap and proof until slightly puffy, 15 to 20 minutes.
Preheat a cast iron skillet over medium heat until very hot, 5 to 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, roll each piece proofed dough into a 1/8-inch-thick oval. Sprinkle some cilantro on top and press lightly to adhere.
Working in batches, cook naan in the hot skillet until large bubbles form, 1 to 2 minutes. Flip, press gently, and continue to cook until bubbles on the bottom are charred, 2 to 3 minutes more.
Brush naan with more garlic butter before serving.

review.reviewBody: Delicious & easy! Cast iron pan was perfect, not really frying just really baking on stove in hot pan like tandoori & cooks really fast! It was very good by itself or dipped in tzatziki sauce too. I’m going to make it again when I make coconut curry chicken.

So good!! I cooked it on a pre-heated cookie sheet in the oven on the low broiler setting. 1-2 minutes each side. If you pre-heat the cookie sheet, and the temp is hot enough, they will blow up like a balloon!
Very tastey
I really like it. Though I put chopped garlic in my dough and less garlic in the butter.

Dough is hard to get down and stay as thin as most naan that I’ve had in restaurant. Cooked in skillet and in ooni pizza oven - same results. None the less it was delicious and gone at the end of dinner!

Love Chef John's recipes and I've used this one over and over. 

I do a garlic oil instead of butter to cut back on the dairy a bit and it's still yummy!
So easy to make with a delicious flavour!
This was actually the first bread I had ever made. It was perfect!
Fantastic recipe, love this!

Loved this recipe! Tender & savory with garlic and butter for an added bonus. I brushed each one with garlic butter and a sprinkle of flaky sea salt & used a mix of fresh parsley & cilantro. I served this with Butter Chicken & jasmine rice.
A great success!
This was delicious! The only thing that I changed was adding more garlic to the garlic butter. There’s no such thing as too much garlic, right? Lol!
This is amazing! We make it all of the time and especially love using it for hummus sandwiches.
Made this and it went great with curry!
This was delicious. Thank you chef John!
We have been experimenting with different bread recipes and this one is our favorite so far. The taste is very authentic.

This is beyond delicious - made the recipe exactly as posted except I halved the butter and had plenty. The only problem is that next time I have to double the whole recipe because my family inhaled the bread so fast!

Well, I would have added a photo but we ate it to fast! This was so easy and delicious! I didn’t have any plain yogurt so I used sour cream but will use yogurt next time to keep the calories down. This bread took so little time, easy to make on a weeknight. I’m already thinking of all the yummy things I can make with/on them. I think this naan would make great pizza crust.
Amazing, Chef John you did it again!

This recipe is legit! Turned out great! I first tried the cast iron skillet until it got white hot, but that ended up being too hot and it burned right away (apparently I thought I was blackening fish!). Then I just used a regular frying pan, butter, and it worked just fine, though I flipped it a few more times to make sure it didn't stick. The bubbles blackened and it turned out great. This is a new staple/favorite for our family.

I did exactly by the recipe...except i used fresh sage and rosemary in place of the cilantro. We will be topping it with caramelized onions and mushrooms, fontina and goat cheeses, then a bit of arugula!

Very good. I used Bob's Mill Whole Wheat pastry flour and should have used less than 2 cups of flour- next time I will add 1\2 and then add more as needed. I might cook on outside grill as my smoke alarm went off, or, not have so hot. I used more garlic, 2 is never enough in my experience. Thanks for recipe!
Great recipe! Really tasty

Wonderful! I used whole wheat flour and we all agreed it tasted better than our local Indian restaurants naan bread. One of the dough balls we rolled out very thin and put cheese, curry, the garlic butter on one side. Then folded the other side over on the cheese side, crimped the edges and cooked it. It was tasty! This recipe is a keeper.
So easy to follow. I also didn’t have yogurt so substituted sour cream. Came out delicious!

I love this bread with a curry. My method was pretty well as described here, but not completely. I did not have yoghurt, skipped it. And I used a bread maker to mix. I find my kitchen a little cool for proofing the dough. Delicious bread to complement your main course.
Followed exactly. Perfect.

This was so much better than store bought. It takes a little patience to fry them up in the skillet, but so worth the wait! Followed directions exactly! I was impressed at how good this turned out on my first try at making Naan bread. Will add this to my regular bread making recipes! (served with his creamy cashew chicken curry)

Apparently high heat on a glass electric cook top is way too hot. The first one was scorched in seconds and the others just cooked too fast. Everything else was awesome. The flavor and smell was spot on and indeed the more I made, the better they got. This was mainly because my skillet needed to cook a bit.
No changes made. Will make again.
Thank you Chef John for this fabulous Naan.. It's like eating in a 5-star Indian Restaurant. I even sang your song to my wife and scored us the ultimate eye roll!

This is a very easy-to-follow recipe. I substituted sour cream for greek yogurt, and it worked great. It's delicious fresh, or later, and I have used it for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Thank you for an amazing recipe.
Great recipe. I will roll them a bit thicker next time. It turned out very well and was a hit
I am slowly conquering my fear of yeast breads - this was a bit time-consuming, but it came out so delicious, and in the end it was so so so easy!

I used a cast iron skillet, it worked very well for the bread. My first time trying making naan. This was easy to follow and very happy with the results. I will be enjoying it with my experimental Indian vegetable stew. I ususally make chicken tikka masala, but thought I would try something different. Thank you for sharing.
Rather than frying it I baked it at high heat on a pizza stone. Cooked at 400 degrees for 12 minutes. browned nicely. Flavor was perfect. Used it for appetizer base.

oh yeah!!!!! served this with a home made chicken tikka masala and it disappeared in no time!!!! I was sorry I didn't make two batches. Very easy to pull off! Helps if you have a large cast iron skillet that will get SMOKING HOT.

OMG!! I never thought I would be able to make this at home. I used my cast iron skillet and heated it up super hot. Follow the directions and you will be eating and enjoying this beautiful Naan in no time.
Very easy recipe to follow and the video made it much better to watch Chef Johns recipe. Loved the term “shaggy dough”

Wonderful bread! will have to say I had to sub sour cream for yogurt, wife ate the last of the yogurt, doh! Did roll a bit thinner than 1/8" but cooked up to about 1/4". Reminded me of a pancake, soft, but had a wonderful chewy side to it. Can not have enough butter and garlic in one's life!
Very good naan recipe and easy to make! Cooked it on a cast iron pan and they came out great!
Delicious! Be sure to roll thin enough. My first couple were a bit thick. They bubbled and charred beautifully! So good!
Awesome naan- love the addition of cilantro too!

Delicious and chewy! Although high heat is too hot for making this on a cast iron. My first few ended up burnt due to the instructions to heat my pan as hot as possible. Medium high is perfect for some slight charring. Also I used just regular flour and rolled some chopped garlic in with the cilantro to add even more texture and it turned out very yummy! Thank you chef John!

The second piece I cooked turned out good. High seems like it was too hot on an electric coil stove. I ended up with charred spots that are similar to the ones pictured when I turned the burner down to medium.

I think that 1/2 recipe of the garlic butter is the right amount for the bread in this recipe.
awesome. Thanks for the recipe!

made this today alongside your creamy cashew chicken curry.i have never eaten naan bread so I have nothing to compare to but I think it was awesome.i made as written.dough was very easy to work with.will make again and use as mini pizza crusts
